title: Festival Survival Guide
description: Essential tips and information to make your Sziget experience amazing, safe, and unforgettable. Everything here works offline, so you'll never be stranded.

items.title: Stay Hydrated
items.content: Drink plenty of water! Dehydration is the fastest way to ruin your festival. Refill stations are available throughout the island. Bring a reusable bottle.

items.title: Pace Yourself
items.content: Sziget is a marathon, not a sprint. Don't go too hard on the first day. Get some sleep, eat proper meals, and take breaks in the shade.

items.title: Plan Your Day, But Be Flexible
items.content: Use this app to favorite your must-see artists, but don't be afraid to wander. Some of the best discoveries are acts you stumble upon by chance.

items.title: Comfortable Shoes Are a Must
items.content: You'll be walking and dancing for miles every day. Prioritize comfort over style. Your feet will thank you.

items.title: Secure Your Valuables
items.content: Use a secure bag or money belt. Be mindful of your surroundings, especially in dense crowds. Consider using the on-site lockers for passports and larger valuables.

items.title: First Aid & Medical
items.content: First aid tents are clearly marked on the festival map. Don't hesitate to visit them for any issue, big or small. The staff is there to help.

items.title: Emergency Services
items.content: In a serious emergency, find the nearest security guard or staff member. The general emergency number in Hungary is 112.

items.title: Look After Your Friends
items.content: Establish a meeting point in case you get separated. Keep an eye on each other and seek help if a friend seems unwell.

items.title: Sun Protection
items.content: The sun can be intense. Use sunscreen, wear a hat, and find shade during the peak hours of the afternoon.

items.title: Prohibited Items
items.content: Glass, pyrotechnics, professional recording equipment, and illicit substances are strictly forbidden. Check the official Sziget website for a full list before you pack.

items.title: Cashless System
items.content: Sziget is a cashless festival. You'll use your wristband (topped up via the official app or at top-up points) to pay for everything.

items.title: Be a Good Szitizen
items.content: Respect the island, the staff, and your fellow festival-goers. Dispose of your trash in the designated bins. The 'Island of Freedom' works best when everyone is respectful.
